Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the path points of a polyline annotation at run time.
Docs.value: A object with the polyline shape.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A polyline must use coordinates relative to an annotation object, where (0,0) denotes the top-left coordinates and (100,100) denotes the bottom-right coordinates of the annotation.
This property is not accessible at design time, when you should use the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.PolylineAnnotation.GraphicsPathPoints%2A> property instead.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the path points of the polyline annotation at design time.
Docs.value: An object with the polyline shape.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A polyline must use coordinates relative to an annotation object, where (0,0) denotes the top-left coordinates and (100,100) denotes the bottom-right coordinates of the annotation.
This property is not accessible at run time, when you should use the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.PolylineAnnotation.GraphicsPath%2A> property instead.

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")
set: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a flag that determines whether an annotation should be placed using the free-draw mode.
Docs.value: if an annotation should be placed using free-draw mode; otherwise,. The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Two different placement modes are supported when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.BeginPlacement%2A> method is called. Set the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.PolylineAnnotation.IsFreeDrawPlacement%2A> property to `true` to switch from the default mode to free-draw mode, which allows the user to freely-draw while moving the mouse cursor.
